values.description:
The ign-msgs ABI jobs have been failing because ign-cmake isn't being installed. This happens because the `_MAJOR_VERSION` variable isn't being set in the build script.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=14)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/14/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/14/

In 3aa4d86, I set the variable in `ignition-abichecker.bash`, but that failed to find the `ign-cmake1` prerelease package:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=15)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/15/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/15/

so in 3b66984, we use prereleases in ignition abi jobs, but that failed because the initial hg clone is always on default, so the `_MAJOR_VERSION` variable might not match the branches that will actually be built:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=16)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/16/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/16/

so in e6b5556, we clone the `TARGET_BRANCH` instead of default. Now it's working!

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=17)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/17/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/17/
values.title: set IGN_*_MAJOR_VERSION variable in abi jobs

values.description:
There are several packages that optionally depend on `libignition-tools-dev` for testing their `ign` commands, but we weren't installing this package for our CI. This installs the package for fuel-tools, msgs, transport and sdformat. We no longer need to build `ign-tools` from source for ign-transport

I've disabled the sdformat-ci-default-trusty build since we don't have `libignition-tools-dev` on trusty. It also lets us install math4 for sdformat6+.

## test builds:

sdformat6 ign test fails: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-sdformat6-xenial-amd64&build=10)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat6-xenial-amd64/10/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat6-xenial-amd64/10/

ign-fuel-tools1: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools1-xenial-amd64&build=6)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools1-xenial-amd64/6/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-ign-fuel-tools1-xenial-amd64/6/

ign-msgs1: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-ci-ign-msgs1-xenial-amd64&build=26)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-ign-msgs1-xenial-amd64/26/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-ign-msgs1-xenial-amd64/26/

ign-transport3: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-xenial-amd64&build=20)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-xenial-amd64/20/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport3-xenial-amd64/20/

ign-transport4: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport4-xenial-amd64&build=13)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport4-xenial-amd64/13/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_transport-ci-ign-transport4-xenial-amd64/13/

ign-gui: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64&build=117)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/117) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/117/testReport/(root)/CmdLine/ (from [ign-gui pull request 102](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/102/fix-ign_test-cmake-logic-use-ign-cmake/commits))

values.description:
It seems that a job fails whenever the disk space on optimus gets too full and it tries to remove all images. Here's the most recent one:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_rendering-ci-default-artful-amd64/3/console

it seems that it's unable to remove all docker images, which causes a failure, even though it succeeded in freeing up a bunch of disk space.

~~~
Error response from daemon: conflict: unable to delete a64b2fc46167 (cannot be forced) - image has dependent child images
Error response from daemon: conflict: unable to delete 1510638c0344 (cannot be forced) - image has dependent child images
Error response from daemon: conflict: unable to delete a1cbdcb894c4 (cannot be forced) - image has dependent child images
~~~

values.description:
We keep buildcop reports in the gazebo wiki. There is a script that helps make these, but they require some fine-tuning. Here's yesterday's report that I made:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/wiki/buildcop/2018/04/19.md

I've added some of the reasons for perennial build failures to the script to make it easier to generate these report. They still require a little bit of adjustment, but I think this is an improvement. For example, here's what it generates right now:

values.description: I occasionally get `[Errno 104] Connection reset by peer` when trying to upload a tarball with `s3cmd put` during a release.py call. It was just happening to me now with the ign-common2 prerelease. I noticed that [someone recommends](https://www.pimp-my-rig.com/2016/12/s3cmd-errno-104-connection-reset-by-peer.html) using `s3cmd sync` instead of `s3cmd put`, and that fixed their problem. I tried that, and it worked for me.
values.title: use s3cmd sync instead of s3cmd put to avoid [Errno 104] Connection reset by peer

summary.raw: I occasionally get `[Errno 104] Connection reset by peer` when trying to upload a tarball with `s3cmd put` during a release.py call. values.description:
There is a problem with qemu on arm64. It is [hanging apt jobs](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/opensplice-debbuilder/79/console) with the following message:

`qemu: Unsupported syscall: 277`

The 277 syscall in arm64 qemu is related to seccomp and the problem is that it has not being implemented. The error hangs apt when processing man-db operations \(call seccomp\). That can be avoided by setting the variable `MAN_DISABLE_SECCOMP`to 1.

Tested here: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/opensplice-debbuilder/80/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/opensplice-debbuilder/80/)

FYI: @nuclearsandwich
values.title: Workaround for arm64 qemu problem with man-db

values.description:
Lots of builds have been failing on optimus recently due to a lack of disk space even though we have logic to clean out old docker stuff when disk space gets too low. Something changed and the script is not working. For example:

from [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64&build=352)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/352/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/352/

~~~
+++ docker_mount_point=/var/lib/docker
~~~

The docker mount point is really `/` but for some reason it's not finding that. So the later grep statements are failing. So instead of selecting the 6th entry (`awk '{ print $6 }'`), we select the device in the 1st entry (`awk '{ print $1 }'`). I think this is more reliable.

testing:

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64&build=431)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/431/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/431/
values.title: Fix checking for free space when cleaning docker stuff

values.description:
Until now, all our packages followed the convention of not using underscores as the project name \(defined in CMakeLists.txt\). Ignition fuel tools is the only project using underscores for the project name, we can easily allow it to work by removing the safety check.

The call for releasing should be:

    release.py ign-fuel-tools X.Y.Z <pass> -a ignition-fuel_toolsX --ignition-repo

We need to update changelogs in -release repo to match this name with underscore. The tarball names will change to use this format too.
values.title: Allow release.py to use underscores in alias (for ignition-fuel_tools)

values.description:
After reviewing the Debian policy about naming, I realized that underscores are not allowed in the a debian package source name \(used in debian/control in the first line and debian/changelog\). With this in mind, the changes in PR #586 should be fixed by this one.

This PR back to enable the check over the underscores and try to detect the tarball generated from code \(create from project name\) using the current behaviour and as a fallback method, it replaces the dash by an underscore for the project using this naming scheme. It is not really robust but should work for \`ignition-fuel\_tools\`.

`release.py ign-fuel-tools X.Y.Z <pass> -a ignition-fuel-toolsX --ignition-repo`

values.description:
Fixes #44. There are two main parts to this:

1. Change ABI branch parameters names from `ORIGIN_BRANCH` / `TARGET_BRANCH` to `SRC_BRANCH` / `DEST_BRANCH` to match other jobs. This was done in the first few commits of this branch, and this partial diff can be seen [here](#!/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/0e501f2dbdf3fdcb4873fdd1c771b837598e1aac%0Ddefault#diff). This allows the branch parameters to be inherited a little more easily from the upstream job.

2. Add `SRC_REPO` variable and update build scripts to use `SRC_`/`DEST_` variables. [Partial diff is here](#!/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/dsl_abi_fork%0D0e501f2dbdf3#diff). It makes sure that the initial checkout of the repos are on a relevant branch so the major version and dependency information can be inferred.

Tested:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=_dsl_sdformat&build=577)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_sdformat/577/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_sdformat/577/

* upstream job from fork [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64&build=237)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/237/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64/237/

* ABI job from fork [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=105)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/105/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/105/

  1. Change ABI branch parameters names from ORIGIN_BRANCH / TARGET_BRANCH to SRC_BRANCH / DEST_BRANCH to match other jobs. values.description:
It is currently generation only jobs for `Bionic/Melodic`but there is support in place for `Xenial/Kinetic`

The [jobs generated](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_subt/5) are:

* The -ci- to run on changes on default branch
* The -ci-pr\_any- to be used in the pull request
* The debbuilder for releases
* The -install- to test packages \(currently disabled\)

The compilation job includes a [smoke test](#!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/new#Ljenkins-scripts/docker/lib/subt-compilation-base.bashT29) that runs the launch file during a few second to test for big big failures or problems in the startup.

Testing job:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=13)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/13) [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/1](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/1)3

    * ~~Failing because libgazebo\_server\_fixture is not in the Ubuntu package \(bug\)~~. Unstable because of a [cpp warning](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-default-bionic-amd64/10/warnings22Result/new).
